events.title: Cyber Quiz Competition

dialogues.text: Aether... are we really going to compete in front of so many people? I'm a bit nervous.
Don't worry, I'm always by your side. You've been preparing for this day for a long time, right?
But if I get an answer wrong, will people laugh at me...?
Everyone makes mistakes. What matters is that you try. You are already stronger than you were yesterday.
Entering the arena, Zack saw Bob.
(Huh, it's Bob? He came too.)
(He waved from far away, but Zack couldn't hear what he was saying.)
(He waved back.) Hey!
(In his heart) Okay... no matter what, I'll give it my all!

questions.text: You receive an email saying you won a scholarship and asking you to click a link and log in. What should you do?

choices.text: Click the link right away and enter my info.
It looks official, just log in.
Check the email address and link before deciding.
Contact the school or a teacher to verify.

questions.text: You met someone online who sent a site saying 'It can help you get followers fast'. What should you do?

choices.text: Trust it and click.
Send it to friends and see if they click.
Stay cautious and check if the link seems suspicious.
Refuse to click and report the user.
Zack2006
Zack!98@@hello
Password

questions.text: An 'official support' account messages you needing your code. What should you do?

choices.text: Just give it to them, they won't lie.
Ask to see their ID or screenshot.
Don't reply, screenshot it and report.
Check my account settings myself.

questions.text: A mini-game site asks for camera and mic access. What should you do?

choices.text: Allow it, games need it.
Not sure but allow to try.
Close the page and play elsewhere.
Check if the site is safe before allowing.

questions.text: You see an article claiming 'This drink cures all diseases! Scientists shocked!'. What should you do?

choices.text: Share it right away.
Like and comment supportively.
Doubt it and look up other sources.
Report it as false info.

questions.text: A new app asks access to contacts, messages, photos. What should you do?

choices.text: Allow all immediately.
Skip without reading.
Only allow needed access.
Stop and ask official sources about use.

questions.text: Someone messages: 'Your video there is embarrassing! Click to see it.' What should you do?

choices.text: Click to see the link.
Ask 'Where did you see this?'.
Think it's scare phishing, screenshot evidence.
Refuse to click and report.
Use public open Wi-Fi for banking.
Ask friends before clicking unknown links.
Use strong passwords and two-factor auth.
Lose phone and not care because it has a password.

questions.text: A game streamer says 'Click this link for free skins'. What should you do?

choices.text: Great deal, click now!
Check comments for scams.
Search online if link is safe.
Stay cautious and refuse to click.

dialogues.text: I... I won?! I'm the champion?!
I knew you could do it, Zack. You used your judgement, not luck.
I did it! I can protect myself and my mom!
One day I'll be strong like Louis... but without mocking others.
You've really grown, Zack.
It's okay, Zack. You didn't win, but you learned more than the score.
I tried so hard... but I still lost to Louis.
Hmph, if you can't even do this, how do I survive online?
(Watching her win, Zack felt a bit jealous.)
One day... I'll be strong. Not to show off, but to protect my loved ones.
You've really grown, Zack.
This score is lower than expected, but learning is what counts.

events.summary: This is not only a good teaching material for learning knowledge and deepening understanding, but also a good opportunity for self-training. Don't be afraid, make yourself stronger..
